title: Designing Better UX For Left-Handed People
description: Today, roughly 10% of people are left-handed. Yet most products — digital and physical — aren’t designed with it in mind. Let’s change that. More design patterns in Smart Interface Design Patterns, a **friendly video course on UX** and design patterns by Vitaly.
author: Vitaly Friedman

title: Handling JavaScript Event Listeners With Parameters
description: Event listeners are essential for interactivity in JavaScript, but they can quietly cause memory leaks if not removed properly. And what if your event listener needs parameters? That’s where things get interesting. Amejimaobari Ollornwi shares which JavaScript features make handling parameters with event handlers both possible and well-supported.
author: Amejimaobari Ollornwi

title: I Didn’t Think One-Click Retouching Could Look This Good — Then I Tried Retouch4me Face Make
description: I Didn’t Think One-Click Retouching Could Look This Good — Then I Tried Retouch4me Face Make Another AI photo editing tool? I’ll be honest; I didn’t expect much. At this ... Read more
author: Sarika

title: 17+ Best Viking Fonts for Nordic Designs
description: Board the longboats and bring our list of the best viking fonts to any of your projects. With any of these fonts, you can add a warrior's spirit.
author: Jacob Cass

title: UX Strategies for Complex-Application Design
description: UX in complex, specialized domains requires adapting familiar methods across the design lifecycle to address domain constraints and expert-user needs.
author: Kate Kaplan

title: Mixed-Methods Research: Combining Qualitative and Quantitative Data
description: Mixed-methods research combines qualitative and quantitative methods to explore a single research question.
author: Rachel Banawa

title: Unveiling Inspiring UI Design Examples and Insights
description: User Interface (UI) design serves as the critical link connecting users with digital products, culminating in seamless and delightful experiences. description: Product development has been a hit sauce for the last two years now. title: How to Group Your Sidebar Items for Better Findability
description: When a sidebar contains many items, grouping is necessary to help users find them faster. However, most designers don’t group their sidebar items and force users to scan an entire list. This results in slow navigation times and poor findability. Grouping improves findability by enabling users to spot a group and scan the items in […] The post How to Group Your Sidebar Items for Better Findability first appeared on UX Movement.
author: anthony

title: How to Make Any Sidebar Menu Easier to Scan
description: How easy to scan is your sidebar menu? If you haven’t optimized the spacing, users will likely spend more time navigating and finding items. Balancing the spacing in the sidebar can help users navigate faster and easier. A typical mistake designers make is adding too much or not enough space. Both can make scanning for […] The post How to Make Any Sidebar Menu Easier to Scan first appeared on UX Movement.
author: anthony
